clinical_study.brief_title: Red Cell Distribution Width as a Predictor of Mortality in Acute Methanol Poisoning
clinical_study.official_title: Red Cell Distribution Width as a Predictor of Mortality in Acute Methanol Poisoning

lead_sponsor.agency: Adana Numune Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Adana Numune Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: aim to investigate the relationship between the RDW and 7-day mortality during acute methanol poisoning.

detailed_description.textblock: RDW values have been found to be an independent predictor of the prognosis among patients with heart diseases, stroke,community-acquired pneumonia (CAP), pulmonary embolism, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), septic shock, and acute pancreatitis.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with acute methanol toxicity who were diagnosed and treated at the Adana City Training and Research Hospital, Mersin City Training and Research Hospital.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
All patients aged ≥16 years who were admitted to both emergency departments from January 2018 to September 2019 on account of acute methanol intoxication.
Exclusion Criteria:
prehospital cardiac arrest transfer to another hospital
